title: FLOWDEC: A FLOW-BASED FULL-BAND GENERAL AUDIO CODEC WITH HIGH PERCEPTUAL QUALITY
author: Simon Welker (University of Hamburg), Matthew Le (Meta), Ricky T.Q. Chen (Meta), Wei-Ning Hsu (Meta), Timo Gerkmann (University of Hamburg), Alexander Richard (Meta), Yi-Chiao Wu (Meta), ...,
relevance_why: FlowDec introduces a novel audio codec utilizing flow-based generative models, which can enhance audio quality applications in Haohe Liu's research, particularly in low-bitrate audio coding and audio quality improvement.
background: Developing an audio codec that compresses and reconstructs quality audio signals at low bitrates while maintaining high perceptual quality.
contribution: This paper introduces FlowDec to solve the problem of high-quality audio coding at low bitrates, achieving competitive performance against state-of-the-art GAN-based models.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods like ScoreDec focused on speech and required around 60 deep neural network evaluations at real-time factors unsuitable for practical applications.
technical_comparison.novelty: The proposed FlowDec reduces the required evaluations to as low as 6 while extending capabilities to full-band general audio beyond just speech and further lowering bitrates.

key_innovation: FlowDec uses a novel adaptation of conditional flow matching for audio enhancement, which significantly minimizes inference complexity and maintains audio fidelity.
real_world_impact: FlowDec has potential applications in mobile communications and live video streaming, providing a more efficient audio codec for real-time applications with high audio quality.

new_terms.conditional flow matching: **Conditional flow matching** is a technique that aligns generated audio samples with the characteristics of clean audio samples to achieve better perceptual quality.
new_terms.bitrate: **Bitrate** refers to the number of bits that are processed or transmitted in a given amount of time, affecting the audio quality and size of digital media.

open_sourcing: The code and pretrained model checkpoints for FlowDec are available on GitHub at https://github.com/facebookresearch/FlowDec.
